Header: Workshopfor the introduction of new varieties of prawns for shrimp cultivators
Content: A workshop for the introduction of new varieties of prawns for shrimp cultivators of the Puttalam District was held in Chilaw. It was organized under the patronage of State Minister Dilip Wedarachchi. SPF Monodone and SPF Vanami varieties were introduced at this workshop. Its objective is to uplift the shrimp industry. These disease-resistant varieties give growers the opportunity to achieve a successful harvest. State Minister Dilip Wedarachchi said that Sri Lanka has tens of thousands of lagoons and tanks. He said his intention is to develop the inland fisheries sector and produce the fisheries resources required by the country. Shrimp cultivation is mostly operative in the Puttalam District. He said that the Government is taking action to provide the required resources and technology for the district.
